column1: Korenovsk (Russian: Корено́вск) is a town and the administrative center of Korenovsky District of Krasnodar Krai
column3: located on the Beysuzhyok Levy River (a tributary of the Beysug) 64 kilometers (40 mi) northeast of Krasnodar. Population: 41

column1: It was founded in 1794 by Cossacks of the Black Sea Cossack Army as Korenovskoye (Корено́вское)
column2: called so to commemorate a kurin of the same name in the Zaporozhian Host. Since the end of the 19th century
column3: it had been known as the stanitsa of Korenovskaya (Корено́вская).During the Great Patriotic War
column4: local Jewish community was murdered by an Einsatzgruppe.Town status was granted in 1961.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Korenovsk serves as the administrative center of Korenovsky District. As an administrative division
column5: incorporated within Korenovsky District as the Town of Korenovsk. As a municipal division
column6: the Town of Korenovsk is incorporated within Korenovsky Municipal District as Korenovskoye Urban Settlement.

column1: Управление по взаимодействию с органами местного самоуправления Администрации Краснодарского края.
